intro: Azalea calendulacea var. flammea, commonly known as the flame azalea, is a flowering shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from orange to red, often with a yellow throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. The flowers bloom in spring, adding a striking visual impact to gardens and natural landscapes.
